solution_line_template: The {num_pigs_group1} pigs that are sold after {months_group1} months will cost the farmer {months_group1}*{cost_per_month_per_pig}*{num_pigs_group1} = $<<{months_group1}*{cost_per_month_per_pig}*{num_pigs_group1}={food_cost_group1}>>{food_cost_group1} in food costs.

The {num_pigs_group2} pigs that are sold after {months_group2} months will cost the farmer {months_group2}*{cost_per_month_per_pig}*{num_pigs_group2} = $<<{months_group2}*{cost_per_month_per_pig}*{num_pigs_group2}={food_cost_group2}>>{food_cost_group2} in food costs.
Thus, the total food cost to raise the 6 piglets was {food_cost_group1} + {food_cost_group2} = $<<{food_cost_group1}+{food_cost_group2}={total_food_cost}>>{total_food_cost}.
Next, selling the {total_pigs_sold} fully grown pigs will earn the farmer {total_pigs_sold}*{price_per_pig} = $<<{total_pigs_sold}*{price_per_pig}={total_revenue}>>{total_revenue} in revenue.
Therefore, the earn the farmer {total_revenue} - {total_food_cost} = $<<{total_revenue}-{total_food_cost}={profit}>>{profit} in profit from these sales.
